title: StreamSuites Unified Runtime
description: The unified runtime is the authoritative automation engine. It enforces quotas, schedules jobs, ingests platform chat, aggregates signals, and emits deterministic exports that drive all dashboard views and public galleries. Contracts are locked for current modules and exports ship continuously; remaining alpha work tightens orchestration depth and platform parity without claiming live interactivity on the dashboards.
tooltip: 70% · 65–70% Locked — Deterministic exports drive dashboard/public surfaces; further orchestration and parity in progress.

title: Administrator Dashboard UI
description: The administrator dashboard provides a static, read-only observability surface for runtime exports, configuration state, and public gallery parity. It is intentionally non-interactive and designed for debugging, inspection, and system-wide visibility without issuing live commands; alpha coverage is focused on export fidelity over controls.
tooltip: 68% · 65–70% Locked — Static, export-driven UI aligned with runtime observability.

title: Creator Dashboard UI
description: Creator-facing flows expose profiles, platform toggles, triggers, and module scaffolding in a schema-aligned layout. Current alpha behavior is draft-only: forms mirror runtime schemas and output exports for review, but apply/write paths remain disabled and require manual import by operators.
tooltip: 48% · 45–50% Integrated — Draft exports align to runtime schemas; live apply remains off.

title: Public Interface & Gallery Surface
description: The public interface exposes runtime-derived artifacts such as clips, polls, tallies, scoreboards, and replay views through static, read-only pages. All content is sourced exclusively from deterministic runtime exports, ensuring parity, safety, and zero live execution. Gallery and detail routes are live; continued work targets navigation cohesion and cross-module linking.
tooltip: 55% · 50–55% Integrated — Public pages render authoritative runtime exports with no live logic.

title: Discord Client
description: The Discord adapter targets bot presence, notifications, and command parity with other platforms. Foundations exist for heartbeat visibility and quota-safe connection management, but command wiring and export alignment are still structural; no dashboard-facing live controls are enabled.
tooltip: 32% · 30–35% Scaffolded — Presence scaffolding exists; command parity and exports remain in progress.

title: Rumble Chat Ingest Pipeline
meta: Paused · SSE-first architecture with runtime hold
description: Paused. Rumble chat ingests via SSE when available and automatically falls back to DOM-based collection or API polling. Stable exports exist for dashboards and public pages, but the pipeline is on hold while integration hardening completes for production rollout.
tooltip: 55% · 55–60% Integrated — Integrated with runtime orchestration and quotas but paused pending rollout.

title: Twitch Chat Runtime
description: The Twitch runtime path is designed around IRC ingestion, trigger matching, and export-ready normalization. Controlled ingestion and normalization paths exist, but exports are still being mapped to dashboard/public expectations and quota enforcement parity is pending before broader use.
tooltip: 38% · 35–40% Functional — Ingestion runs in test; export alignment and quotas still gating release.

title: YouTube Chat Runtime
description: YouTube support is scoped to ingest live chat, align payloads with runtime schemas, and export snapshots the dashboard can render. Scaffold and partial mapping drafts exist, but live ingestion and exports remain staged and are not yet wired into dashboards.
tooltip: 30% · 25–30% Scaffolded — Foundational scaffolding with partial mappings; live exports not enabled.

title: Twitter Client / Integration
description: Twitter integration is purely conceptual, aimed at future ingestion of mentions, DMs, or chat-like events. The intent is a moderation and announcement surface once platform rules allow it. No scaffolding or exports exist yet; the dashboard only reserves a placeholder.
tooltip: 5% · 0–5% Concept — Conceptual only. No runtime scaffolding or contracts exist yet.

title: Chat Triggers
description: Trigger definitions run inside the runtime with deterministic matching, quotas, and cooldown enforcement. Exports include trigger catalogs and response shapes that the dashboard and public pages render read-only. Expansion work is active for platform coverage and moderation actions; dashboards remain observation-only.
tooltip: 62% · 60–65% Integrated — Runtime enforcement live; exports visible read-only while parity expands.

title: Cross-Platform Chat Abstraction
description: A cross-platform layer will normalize chat events across Rumble, Twitch, and YouTube so triggers, scoreboards, and moderation tools work uniformly. Draft normalization rules and export targets exist, but runtime enforcement and full parity are still structural with no live dashboard wiring yet.
tooltip: 32% · 30–35% Scaffolded — Draft normalization exists; enforcement/export cadence still in build-out.

title: Telemetry Export Surface
description: Telemetry exports are intended to expose health, quota, and heartbeat signals the dashboard can graph without live calls. Scaffolding exists with limited alpha feeds; broader signals and automated cadences remain in development before dashboards shift from placeholder charts to live exports.
tooltip: 35% · 35–40% Functional — Draft exports exist; broader health coverage and cadencing still pending.

title: Dashboard ↔ Runtime Schema Contract
description: The schema contract defines exactly how the dashboard consumes exported JSON for creators, platforms, public galleries, and telemetry. It guarantees deterministic imports/exports for current alpha modules and is expanding alongside new runtime drops to keep dashboards and public pages in lockstep.
tooltip: 58% · 55–60% Integrated — Contracts enforced for current modules; coverage expanding per drop.

title: Unified Live Chat Replay Module
description: Chat replay is meant to store and rehydrate message archives for post-stream review across platforms. The UI is staged to visualize those transcripts alongside metadata, but export streams remain draft-only and are not yet rendering live data on dashboard or public pages.
tooltip: 32% · 30–35% Scaffolded — Replay signals exist; stabilized exports and rendering still pending.

title: WinForms GUI (Admin & System Controls)
description: A WinForms control surface is planned for operators who prefer a desktop UI. It is intended to mirror admin views and telemetry without bypassing runtime safety. Planning and layout considerations are in place, but no runtime coupling or exports are implemented yet.
tooltip: 20% · 20–30% Scaffolded — Foundational runtime scaffolding exists (schemas, registries, state paths). No logic execution.

title: Scoreboards
description: Scoreboards aggregate trigger outputs and interaction tallies into public-facing leaderboards. Export shapes and public gallery shells exist and render read-only data; runtime-side aggregation cadence and reset logic are limited to controlled runs and need expansion before routine automation.
tooltip: 45% · 40–50% Functional — Aggregation shapes exist; cadence and resets still being widened.

title: Clips Module
description: The clips module automates livestream clipping, encodes segments with FFmpeg inside the runtime, and marches each clip through deterministic lifecycle states. Finished clips upload to the default StreamSuites Rumble channel today with exports that power dashboard and public gallery/detail pages; destination flexibility and moderation controls are the remaining alpha focus areas.
tooltip: 65% · 60–65% Integrated — Runtime clipping live with exports; moderation and destinations expanding.

title: Polls Module
description: Polls execute in the runtime with strict quotas and deterministic close conditions. Dashboard and public pages show read-only ballots, results, and detail pages sourced from runtime exports. Remaining work focuses on broader platform coverage, richer scheduling, and export cadence tuning before interactive management is considered.
tooltip: 60% · 55–60% Integrated — Runtime-driven polls with read-only dashboards; scheduling depth pending.

title: Tallies Module
description: Tallies are programmatic, chat-driven aggregations that count events over weekly, monthly, or custom windows. Public gallery and detail pages are live and read-only, driven by runtime exports. Runtime scheduling, trigger coupling, and enforcement logic continue to mature before routine automation is enabled.
tooltip: 50% · 45–50% Functional — Runtime aggregation active in limited runs; automation depth expanding.

title: Levelling System
description: Levelling is envisioned as a fictional progression track where chat participation earns experience toward ranks or perks. It should eventually respect cross-platform identity mapping once available. This remains early ideation with no runtime scaffolding beyond concept notes.
tooltip: 10% · 10–15% Planned — Planned and documented. Architecture discussed, but no executable runtime scaffolding.

title: Fake Gambling / Game Mechanics
description: The game mechanics are lightweight chat commands (e.g., !steal, !loot @user) that award or deduct fictional balances. The intent is playful, zero-stakes engagement surfaced in dashboards only. It stays in the planned phase with placeholder UI and no runtime enforcement.
tooltip: 10% · 10–15% Planned — Planned and documented. Architecture discussed, but no executable runtime scaffolding.

title: Paid Interaction Detection
description: Paid interaction detection will surface gifted subscriptions and paid shout-outs (Rumble Rants, Super Chats, etc.) with monthly rollups. The dashboard aims to visualize those exports alongside leaderboards. Design work is underway, but runtime feeds are not yet finalized.
tooltip: 15% · 10–15% Planned — Planned and documented. Architecture discussed, but no executable runtime scaffolding.
